org.transitime.core

Class VehicleState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.VehicleState

  • public class VehicleState
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of vehicle state including its block assignment, where it last matched to its assignment, and AVL reports.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Constructor Detail

      • VehicleState

        public VehicleState(java.lang.String vehicleId)
        Member Functions

    • Method Detail

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(Block newBlock,
                     BlockAssignmentMethod assignmentMethod,
                     java.lang.String assignmentId,
                     boolean predictable)
        Sets the block assignment for vehicle. Also, this is how it is specified whether a vehicle is predictable or not.
        Parameters:
        newBlock - The current block assignment for the vehicle. Set to null if vehicle not assigned.
        assignmentMethod - How vehicle was assigned (AVL feed, auto assigner, etc). Set to null if vehicle not assigned.
        assignmentId - Can be blockId, tripId, or tripShortName. Depends on type of assignment received from AVL feed. Can be null.
        predictable - Whether vehicle is predictable

      • unsetBlock

        public void unsetBlock(BlockAssignmentMethod assignmentMethod)
        Sets the block for this VehicleState to null. Also sets assignmentId to null and predictable to false.
        Parameters:
        assignmentMethod - How vehicle was assigned (AVL feed, auto assigner, etc). Set to null if vehicle not assigned.

      • vehicleNewlyAssignedToSameBlock

        public boolean vehicleNewlyAssignedToSameBlock()
        Determines if vehicle is currently getting assigned and it is getting assigned back to the same block it was assigned to just a while ago. In other words this tells if vehicle might have become unpredictable but then is getting reassigned again. In this kind of situation don't want to for example determine arrivals/departures back to the beginning of the block because probably already did so when vehicle was previously assigned.
        Returns:
        True if vehicle is being reassigned to the same block as before

      • setMatch

        public void setMatch(TemporalMatch match)
        Sets the match for the vehicle into the history. If set to null then VehicleState.predictable is set to false. Also resets numberOfBadMatches to 0.
        Parameters:
        match -

      • getMatch

        public TemporalMatch getMatch()
        Returns the last temporal match. Returns null if there isn't one.
        Returns:

      • getPreviousMatch

        public TemporalMatch getPreviousMatch(int minimumAgeMsec)
        Goes through the match history for the vehicle and returns match that is at least minimumAge old. If there isn't a match that old then returns null.
        Parameters:
        minimumAgeMsec - The minimum age in msec of the match to be returned
        Returns:
        TemporalMatch for vehicle that is at least minimumAge old, or null if there isn't such a match.

      • incrementNumberOfBadMatches

        public void incrementNumberOfBadMatches()
        To be called when predictable vehicle has no valid spatial/temporal match. Only allowed so many of these before vehicle is made unpredictable.

      • overLimitOfBadMatches

        public boolean overLimitOfBadMatches()
        Returns if have exceeded the number of allowed bad matches. If so then vehicle should be made unpredictable.
        Returns:

      • numberOfBadMatches

        public int numberOfBadMatches()
        Returns the number of sequential bad spatial/temporal matches that occurred while vehicle was predictable.
        Returns:
        current number of bad matches

      • lastMatchIsValid

        public boolean lastMatchIsValid()
        Returns true if the last AVL report was successfully matched to the assignment indicating that can generate predictions and arrival/departure times etc.
        Returns:
        True if last match is valid

      • setAvlReport

        public void setAvlReport(AvlReport avlReport)
        Stores the specified avlReport into the history for the vehicle. Makes sure that the AVL history doesn't exceed maximum size.
        Parameters:
        avlReport -

      • getTrip

        public Trip getTrip()
        Returns the current Trip for the vehicle. Returns null if there is not current trip.
        Returns:
        Trip or null.

      • getRouteId

        public java.lang.String getRouteId()
        Returns the current route ID for the vehicle. Returns null if not currently associated with a trip.
        Returns:
        Route ID or null.

      • getRouteShortName

        public java.lang.String getRouteShortName()
        Returns the current route short name for the vehicle. Returns null if not currently associated with a trip.
        Returns:
        route short name or null

      • isLayover

        public boolean isLayover()
        Returns true if last temporal match for vehicle indicates that it is at a layover. A layover stop is a wait stop where a vehicle can leave route path before departing this stop at the scheduled time since the driver is taking a break.
        Returns:
        true if at a layover

      • isWaitStop

        public boolean isWaitStop()
        Returns true if last temporal match for vehicle indicates that it is at a wait stop. A wait stop is when a vehicle is supposed to depart at a scheduled time. A layover is always a wait stop but you can have a wait stop that is not a layover due to the vehicle not being allowed to go away from the stop.
        Returns:
        true if at a wait stop

      • getPreviousMatch

        public TemporalMatch getPreviousMatch()
        Returns the next to last temporal match. Returns null if there isn't one. Useful for when need to compare the previous to last match with the last one, such as for determining if vehicle has crossed any stops.
        Returns:

      • getAvlReport

        public AvlReport getAvlReport()
        Returns the current AvlReport. Returns null if there isn't one.
        Returns:

      • getPreviousAvlReport

        public AvlReport getPreviousAvlReport(double minDistanceFromCurrentReport)
        Looks in the AvlReport history for the most recent AvlReport that is at least minDistanceFromCurrentReport from the current AvlReport. Also makes sure that previous report isn't too old (more than 20 minutes old).
        Parameters:
        minDistanceFromCurrentReport - Distance in meters
        Returns:
        The previous AvlReport, or null if there isn't one that far away within the last 20 minutes.

      • getPreviousAvlReport

        public AvlReport getPreviousAvlReport(int minimumAgeMsec)
        Goes through the AVL history for the vehicle and returns AVL report that is at least minimumAge old. If there isn't a match that old then returns null.
        Parameters:
        minimumAgeMsec - The minimum age in msec of the AVL report to be returned
        Returns:
        AvlReport for vehicle that is at least minimumAge old, or null if there isn't an old enough AVL report in the history.

      • getPreviousAvlReportFromSuccessfulMatch

        public AvlReport getPreviousAvlReportFromSuccessfulMatch()
        Returns the next to last AvlReport where successfully matched the vehicle. This isn't necessarily simply the previous AvlReport since that report might not have been successfully matched. It is important to use the proper AvlReport when matching a vehicle or such because otherwise the elapsed time between the last successful match and the current match would be wrong.
        Returns:
        The last successfully matched AvlReport, or null if no such report is available

      • hasNewAssignment

        public boolean hasNewAssignment(AvlReport avlReport)
        Returns true if the AVL report has a different assignment than what is in the VehicleState. If the avlReport does not have an assignment then false is returned such that the old assignment continues to be used. If a block assignment then simply checks the new block ID from the AVL report to the existing block ID. If using trip assignment in AVL feed then the trip is converted to a block assignment for doing the comparison. When using a route assignment then makes sure the route ID has not changed. For when reassigning a vehicle via the AVL feed.
        Parameters:
        avlReport - For determining possibly new assignment
        Returns:
        True if new assignment such that vehicle needs to be matched to the new assignment.

      • previousAssignmentProblematic

        public boolean previousAssignmentProblematic(AvlReport avlReport)
        Returns true if previously the vehicle had the same assignment but that assignment was recently removed due to a problem where the vehicle shouldn't be assigned to that assignment again. A specific example is that this happens if an exclusive block assignment is grabbed by another vehicle. Even though the original vehicle with the assignment might continue to get that assignment via the AVL feed don't want to reassign it to the problem assignment again.

        BUT WHAT ABOUT A VEHICLE SIMPLY BECOMING UNPREDICTABLE BECAUSE IT TEMPORARILY WENT OFF ROUTE FOR 3 AVL REPORTS?? IN THAT CASE WANT VEHICLE TO MATCH ASSIGNMENT AGAIN. OR WHAT IF BLOCK SIMPLY ENDED?? SEEMS THAT NEED TO REMEMBER IF VEHICLE WAS UNASSIGNED IN SUCH A WAY THAT SHOULDN'T TAKE THAT ASSIGNMENT AGAIN FOR A WHILE.

        An old assignment is considered recent if the unassignment happened within the last 2 hours.

        Parameters:
        avlReport -
        Returns:
        True if vehicle already had the assignment but it was problematic

      • getMatches

        public java.util.List<TemporalMatch> getMatches()
        Returns an unmodifiable list of the match history. The most recent one is first. The size of the list will be not greater than MATCH_HISTORY_SIZE.
        Returns:
        the match history

      • getBlock

        public Block getBlock()
        The current block assignment. But will be null if vehicle not currently assigned.
        Returns:

      • getAssignmentId

        public java.lang.String getAssignmentId()
        Can be the blockId, tripId, or tripShortName depending on the type of assignment received from the AVL feed.
        Returns:
        blockId, tripId, or tripShortName or null if not assigned

      • getAssignmentMethod

        public BlockAssignmentMethod getAssignmentMethod()
        Indicates how the vehicle was assigned (via block assignment, route assignment, auto assignment, etc).
        Returns:

        public boolean isPredictable()

      • isForSchedBasedPreds

        public boolean isForSchedBasedPreds()
        Returns true if not a real vehicle but instead was created to produce schedule based predictions.
        Returns:
        true if for schedule based predictions

      • setArrivalToStoreToDb

        public void setArrivalToStoreToDb(Arrival arrival)
        Records the specified arrival as one that still needs to be stored to the db. This is important because can generate arrivals into the future but need to make sure that the arrival is before the subsequent departure and can't do so until get additional AVL reports.
        Parameters:
        arrival -

      • getArrivalToStoreToDb

        public Arrival getArrivalToStoreToDb()

      • setPredictions

        public void setPredictions(java.util.List<IpcPrediction> predictions)
        Sets the current list of predictions for the vehicle to the predictions parameter.
        Parameters:
        predictions -

      • getPredictions

        public java.util.List<IpcPrediction> getPredictions()
        Gets the current list of predictions for the vehicle. Can be null.
        Returns:

      • setRealTimeSchedAdh

        public void setRealTimeSchedAdh(TemporalDifference realTimeSchedAdh)
        Stores the real-time schedule adherence for the vehicle.
        Parameters:
        realTimeSchedAdh -

      • getRealTimeSchedAdh

        public TemporalDifference getRealTimeSchedAdh()
        Returns the current real-time schedule adherence for the vehicle, or null if schedule adherence not currently valid (vehicle is not predictable or running a non-schedule based assignment).
        Returns:
        The TemporalDifference representing schedule adherence, or null if vehicle not currently predictable or the assignment doesn't have a schedule

      • getPathHeading

        public float getPathHeading()
        Determines the heading of the vector that defines the stop path segment that the vehicle is currently on. The heading will be between 0.0 and 360.0 degrees.
        Returns:
        Heading of vehicle according to path segment. NaN if not currently matched or there is no heading for that segment.

      • getHeading

        public float getHeading()
        Normally uses the heading from getPathHeading(). But if that returns NaN then uses recent valid heading from last AVL report, though that might be NaN as well. This can be better then always using heading from AVL report since that often won't line up with the path and can make vehicles be oriented in noticeably peculiar ways when drawn on an map.
        Returns:
        The best heading for a vehicle
